Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Felder.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Felder moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of September 27 and October 11,2006 be adopted and printed by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Barron moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 27, 2006 and October 11, 2006 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20 b of the Council and Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 70-04 Austin Street, Community Board No. 6 20075075 TCQ, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Concerning the petition of Piu Bello, Inc., to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 70-09 Austin Street, Queens (20075075TCQ).

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20 b of the Council and Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 48 East 12th Street, Community Board No. 6 20065540 TCM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Petition of P12, Inc. d/b/a Piola, to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 48 East 12th Street, Manhattan. (20065540TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution calling upon the Public Service Commission to allow individual apartments to access real-time energy pricing through the use of smart meters.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Public Service Commission to allow individual apartments to access real-time energy pricing through the use of smart meters.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the HUB Third Avenue and the North Flatbush Avenue Business Improvement Districts, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the increasing of the annual expenditures of such districts.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the HUB Third Avenue and the North Flatbush Avenue BIDs.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the Speaker as the Council Member chosen by the Council to serve on the special committee to appoint the director of the City’s Independent Budget Office, in accordance with section 259 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Resolution designating the Speaker as the Council Member chosen by the Council to serve on the special committee to appoint the director of the City’s Independent Budget Office.

Items.Title: Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 923 Barretto Street (Block 2722, Lot 52), The Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered  L.U. No. 300).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 300 - Section 202 Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly, Erma Cava I Housing for the Elderly, 923 Barretto Street, Bronx, Community District No. 2, Council District No. 17

Items.Title: Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 887 Southern Boulevard (Block 2722, Lot 40), The Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 301).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 301 - Section 202 Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly, ECII Housing for the Elderly, 887 Southern Boulevard, Bronx, Community District No. 2, Council District No. 17.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Governmental Operations
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to compensation of the mayor, public advocate, members of the city council, borough presidents, comptroller and district attorneys.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Compensation of the mayor, public advocate, members of the city council, borough presidents, comptroller and district attorneys.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to demolition work without a permit on one- or two-family dwellings.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Demolition work without a permit.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for a violation of a stop work order.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for a violation of a stop work order and for work performed without a permit.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use

Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on an application submitted by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development, ULURP No. C 060409 HAM, approving the designation of 362-364 St. Nicholas Avenue (Block 1955, Lots 2 and 3), Manhattan, as an Urban Development Action Area, approving the project for the area as an Urban Development Action Area Project, and approving the disposition of such property to a developer to be selected by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development  (L.U. No. 215; C 060409 HAM).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 215 - ULURP, 362-364 St. Nicholas Ave., Manhattan (C060409HAM)

No. 207; 20065570 HAM).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to recognize that human trafficking is a crime and to pass legislation criminalizing human trafficking and providing services and programs to trafficking victims.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognize that human trafficking is a crime and to pass legislation criminalizing human trafficking and providing services and programs to trafficking victims.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the office of emergency management.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: In relation to the office of emergency management.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to issue an annual report detailing the health status and treatment of uniformed first responders who are registered with the World Trade Center Health Registry.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Dept of Health and Mental Hygiene to issue an annual report detailing the health status and treatment of uniformed first responders who are registered with the World Trade Center Health Registry.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of City Planning to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to language requirements on signs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Department of City Planning to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to language requirements on signs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Con Edison to remove all forms of footwear and other encumbrances from all phone and power lines in the city of New York to improve the safety and well-being of the residents of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Con Edison to remove of all forms of footwear and other encumbrances from all phone and power lines in NYC to improve the safety and well-being of the residents of NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the disclosure of information regarding past engagement in slavery by city contractors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of information regarding past engagement in slavery by city contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of counterfeit goods.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Sale of counterfeit goods.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a temporary commission to conduct a review of New York City’s child welfare system and offer recommendations for reform.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Establishing a temporary commission to conduct a review of NYC’s child welfare system and offer recommendations for reform.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to priority queue status for alternative fuel taxicabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Priority queue status for alternative fuel taxicabs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requirements for foundation and earthwork permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requirements for foundation and earthwork permits.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to act more swiftly in making the renovations, upgrades and repairs necessary to ensure that people with disabilities are able to fully utilize New York City’s subways, buses, stations and facilities, in the spirit of the 16th anniversary of the passage of the Americans With Disabilities Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to act more swiftly in making the renovations, upgrades and repairs necessary to ensure that people with disabilities are able to fully utilize NYC’s subways, buses, stations and facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing the offense of unlawfully dealing with a minor by certain establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Establishing the offense of unlawfully dealing with a minor by certain establishments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Buildings to assess the merits of the use of plastic lining in pipes within buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Department of Buildings to assess the merits of the use of plastic lining in pipes within buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign Assembly bill A.10944 sponsored by Assemblywoman Deborah Glick, in relation to the renewal of a Rent Stabilized lease and the definition of demolition in the context of the laws that apply to Rent Stabilization.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: The renewal of a Rent Stabilized lease and the definition of demolition in the context of the laws that apply to Rent Stabilization (A10944).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to benchmarking the energy and water efficiency of buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Benchmarking the energy and water efficiency of buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the Redux Beverage Company for producing, advertising, and distributing the “Cocaine” energy drink and calling for all local establishments to refuse to carry or sell “Cocaine” energy drink.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the Redux Beverage Company for producing, advertising, and distributing the “Cocaine” energy drink.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to annual inspection of and reporting on structural integrity in police precincts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Annual inspection of and reporting on structural integrity in police precincts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to annual inspection of and reporting on structural integrity in firehouse and emergency medical service stations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Annual inspection of and reporting on structural integrity in firehouse and emergency medical service stations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of meats.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Sale of meats.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass S.1779/H.R.3931, the “Downed Animal Protection Act,” which would amend the Humane Methods of Livestock Slaughter Act of 1958 to ensure the humane slaughter of non-ambulatory livestock, thus preventing such meat from entering the human food supply.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: “Downed Animal Protection Act” (S.1779/H.R.3931)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to introduce and pass legislation similar to Assembly Bill 10692, which would require insurance companies to cover policyholders’ dependents until the age of 25, regardless of enrollment in an educational institution.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Require insurance companies to cover policyholders’ dependents until the age of 25, regardless of enrollment in an educational institution.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the Speaker as the Council Member chosen by the Council to serve on the special committee to appoint the director of the City’s Independent Budget Office, in accordance with section 259 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Resolution designating the Speaker as the Council Member chosen by the Council to serve on the special committee to appoint the director of the City’s Independent Budget Office.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Disability Rent Increase Exemption (DRIE) program in order to provide parity with respect to the exemptions provided in the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & DIsability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Disability Rent Increase Exemption (DRIE) program.

Items.MinutesNote:
Council Member Avella proposed an amendment to Int No. 458 on the floor.  The proposed amendment was voted down by the full Council by the vote of 2-43-1:

Affirmative- Avella, Mealy-2.

Negative- Addabbo, Arroyo, Barron, Brewer, Comrie, DeBlasio, Dilan, Felder, Fidler, Foster, 
Gallagher, Garodnick, Gennaro, Gentile, Gerson, Gioia, Gonzalez, Jackson, James, Katz, 
Koppell, Lanza, Lappin, Liu, Mark-Viverito, Martinez, McMahon, Mendez, Nelson, Recchia, 
Reyna, Sanders, Seabrook, Sears, Vacca, Vallone, Jr., Vann, Weprin, White, Yassky, Oddo, Rivera, and the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) - 43.

Abstain - Monserrate - 1.

The vote on Int No. 458 itself was then taken -- Int No. 458 was adopted by the Council by an affirmative vote of 41-5-0 (see individual file below).
